properties.Initialization_Name: Release the component from the gripper (click User DO1 and DO2 so that DO1 is 'Off’ and DO2 is 'On’) and place it back on the tray
When the gripper/robot arm is at point 1016 as taught at step 19. Click User DO1 and DO2 so that DO1 is 'Off’ and DO2 is 'On’ to close the gripper

Proceed to generate ppopSetting file for component 1(5 pin). Move robot arm so that component is between gripper in both x and y direction. Close gripper and move component up until its pins are detected by laser. Read the Z-height value from teach pendant or DRAstudio
Repeat steps 19-42 for component 2 with its corresponding points being 1035, 1036, 1038, 1039, 1040, 1041, and 1042

To teach a point in to the RL’s points list, use teach pendant to move robot arm to desired location, then click 'Teach’ button. Remember to 'Save’ after each teaching. New individual insertion position and the corresponding image are a pair for reference. You can never use new position with the old reference images'

properties.Structure_Full_Name: Precise Picked-up Object Positioning Programmable Logic Controller
Precise Picked-up Object Positioning Programmable Logic Controller

properties.Description: Valve Open to close the Gripper
properties.Name: ValveOpen

properties.Description: Valve Close to open the Gripper
properties.Name: ValveClose

properties.Initialization_Name: Repeat steps 19-42 for component 2 with its corresponding points being 1035, 1036, 1038, 1039, 1040, 1041, and 1042
For points 1003 and 1004, 'NGup’ and 'NGdown’, the points location should be at above the NG box and at location where gripper will release the NG components
For points 1003 and 1004, 'NGup’ and 'NGdown’, the points location should be at above the NG box and at location where gripper will release the NG components

For point 1015, 'Feeder1Up’, it will be the same as 1016 for X, Y and RZ value. Change only its Z (mm) value to around 80mm above 1015’s Z value. For example, Z value for 1016 is -131.527 -> set Z value for 1015 to be around -50

For point 1016, 'Feeder1Down’, move robot arm with teach pendant to a location where gripper can grip component 1 on the tray, as shown below.  (make sure gripper is open, DO1 is 'On’ and DO2 is 'Off’)

Move robot arm to point 1018, change the Jog mode to 'Joint’ to convert the values to puu. Record the puu value for J4.
For example, the J4 value below shows -933493 puu, convert puu to degree using the following formula. -933493 puu = (-933493 /15/100000) x 360 = -224.04 degree
Points 1018 and 1019, C1Onfly1A and C1Onfly1B will be the starting and ending point of OnFly     function for component 1

The difference in J4 angle in degree for 1018 and 1019 is bigger then 200 degree is OK.
If less than 200 degree means that for point 1018 and 1019, the DMV camera is not near enough to the cover

Rotate (Rz) the robot arm shaft so that the DMV camera is on the laser source side (height/Z value must remained the same as obtained in step 23). Rotate the shaft until the DMV camera is as close as possible to the PPOP cover. Teach this point as 1018, C1Onfly1A

The difference in J4 angle in degree for 1018 and 1019 is bigger then 200 degree is OK.
If less than 200 degree means that for point 1018 and 1019, the DMV camera is not near enough to the cover
Repeat step 26 by using point 1019
Points 1018 and 1019, C1Onfly1A and C1Onfly1B will be the starting and ending point of OnFly     function for component 1

Move the robot arm to the location where PCB will be stopped on the conveyor, with height/Z value remained the same as step 24. Then, rotate (Rz) the robot arm shaft so that the DMV camera is at the Line/Teledyne Dalsa camera side. Rotate the shaft until the DMV camera is as close as possible to the PPOP cover. Teach this point as 1019, C1Onfly1B
Teach this point as 1021, C1PluginDown (in 'World' mode). Then, change the mode to 'User' and select '1' under 'UF'. Select to highlight row 1022, C1PluginDownUF, click 'Teach' again
Using teach pendant, in ‘Cartesian’ mode and speed ‘1%’, move the component slowly until it is plug in to the corresponding PCB holes
Repeat steps 19-42 for component 2 with its corresponding points being 1035, 1036, 1038, 1039, 1040, 1041, and 1042
Repeat steps 19-42 for component 2 with its corresponding points being 1035, 1036, 1038, 1039, 1040, 1041, and 1042
Repeat steps 19-42 for component 2 with its corresponding points being 1035, 1036, 1038, 1039, 1040, 1041, and 1042
Repeat steps 19-42 for component 2 with its corresponding points being 1035, 1036, 1038, 1039, 1040, 1041, and 1042

For point 1016, 'Feeder1Down’, move robot arm with teach pendant to a location where gripper can grip component 1 on the tray, as shown below.  (make sure gripper is open, DO1 is 'On’ and DO2 is 'Off’)
Release the component from the gripper (click User DO1 and DO2 so that DO1 is 'Off’ and DO2 is 'On’) and place it back on the tray
When the gripper/robot arm is at point 1016 as taught at step 19. Click User DO1 and DO2 so that DO1 is 'Off’ and DO2 is 'On’ to close the gripper

To teach a point in to the RL’s points list, use teach pendant to move robot arm to desired location, then click 'Teach’ button. Remember to 'Save’ after each teaching. New individual insertion position and the corresponding image are a pair for reference. You can never use new position with the old reference images'
Save OnFly Test folder in C:\Delta Industrial Automation\DELTA_IA-Robot_DRAStudio-V1-00-07-18_SW_TSE_20190121\DROEsolution

Open DRAstudio. Click Project>>Click Change Path>> Change Path>>
search for DROEsolution folder in C:\Delta Industrial Automation\DELTA_IA-Robot_DRAStudio-V1-00-07-18_SW_TSE_20190121\DROEsolution
>>click on DROEsolution folder >>OK>>Apply
Click the drag window and select OnFly Test. Click Edit Project
The codes should appear after RL is clicked
Open P-POP setting program by unzipping the file
Type '0’(run onfly RL with no component on gripper)>>Enter
Click on the camera image window and press q to close it
Wait until step 4 message appear. Then make sure no component is on gripper and the robot path is clear. Run the RL program
Type 'y’ in P-POP setting program(step4) and press Enter after Onfly RL program finished running
’Trigger success’ should appear. A file ppopSetting_0 should appear in P-POP setting program folder

Proceed to generate ppopSetting file for component 1(5 pin). Move robot arm so that component is between gripper in both x and y direction. Close gripper and move component up until its pins are detected by laser. Read the Z-height value from teach pendant or DRAstudio
Under 'Points’ tab, key in the Z-height value read from step 11 for all rows
Repeat steps 5-10 for component 1. At step 6, remember to type '1’ instead of 0 as we are generating file for component 1
For component 2 (3 pins), repeat step 11-12, followed by step 5-10
3 files will be generated in P-POP setting folder. Send them to AGPC team to be converted into 'golden’ reference images
Open the '2019 TSM Final’ file with DRAStudio. Click the 'Points’ tab on the left. A list of 42 points will be shown
For points 1001 and 1002, 'Start’ and 'Safe’, one can set them as the same points. The points’ location shall be cleared of any obstructions as PPOP operation will start from here
For points 1003 and 1004, 'NGup’ and 'NGdown’, the points location should be at above the NG box and at location where gripper will release the NG components

For point 1016, 'Feeder1Down’, move robot arm with teach pendant to a location where gripper can grip component 1 on the tray, as shown below.  (make sure gripper is open, DO1 is 'On’ and DO2 is 'Off’)

For point 1015, 'Feeder1Up’, it will be the same as 1016 for X, Y and RZ value. Change only its Z (mm) value to around 80mm above 1015’s Z value. For example, Z value for 1016 is -131.527 -> set Z value for 1015 to be around -50
Points 1018 and 1019, C1Onfly1A and C1Onfly1B will be the starting and ending point of OnFly     function for component 1
When the gripper/robot arm is at point 1016 as taught at step 19. Click User DO1 and DO2 so that DO1 is 'Off’ and DO2 is 'On’ to close the gripper

With component 1 being gripped, move the gripper/robot arm to the height (Z value) where component 1’s pins will be detected by the laser source. You could refer to the height/Z value taught in 'PPOP_Setting program guide’ step 11

Rotate (Rz) the robot arm shaft so that the DMV camera is on the laser source side (height/Z value must remained the same as obtained in step 23). Rotate the shaft until the DMV camera is as close as possible to the PPOP cover. Teach this point as 1018, C1Onfly1A

Move the robot arm to the location where PCB will be stopped on the conveyor, with height/Z value remained the same as step 24. Then, rotate (Rz) the robot arm shaft so that the DMV camera is at the Line/Teledyne Dalsa camera side. Rotate the shaft until the DMV camera is as close as possible to the PPOP cover. Teach this point as 1019, C1Onfly1B
Release the component from the gripper (click User DO1 and DO2 so that DO1 is 'Off’ and DO2 is 'On’) and place it back on the tray

Move robot arm to point 1018, change the Jog mode to 'Joint’ to convert the values to puu. Record the puu value for J4.
For example, the J4 value below shows -933493 puu, convert puu to degree using the following formula. -933493 puu = (-933493 /15/100000) x 360 = -224.04 degree
Repeat step 26 by using point 1019

The difference in J4 angle in degree for 1018 and 1019 is bigger then 200 degree is OK.
If less than 200 degree means that for point 1018 and 1019, the DMV camera is not near enough to the cover
Click the RL tab on the left. Scroll down till line 475. Click on the space beside the number 475. A red dot (breakpoint) will appear on the left

Open the PPOPDemo folder.  
Paste the 'golden reference image’ (obtained from AGPC, TW in the 'PPOP_Setting program guide’) to the PPOP_Reference folder

Click the 'P-POP_demo’ application file. T
The program’s user interface will now show up
Click the 'Analysis' tab, Click 'Set Reference'. Click the Reference Img box on the row of ID1 and browse to the PPOP_Reference folder.
Select the 'golden reference image'. Click 'Save Reference' and it will turn green.Close the window
Click the 'P-POP' tab. Then, select CPU and click 'Start'. Both the 'IDLE' box should turn green and become 'Camera Linked' and 'Linked'
Run the RL program by clicking 'Start'
The robot arm should stop somewhere above the PCB, as the RL program will stop at line 475. Switch the robot arm into 'Manual' mode
Check that on PPOPDemo program, the 'OK' signal should appear on the box on top

Stop the PPOPDemo program. Click the 'Analysis' tab. Click 'Set Reference’. Click the Reference Img box on the row of ID1 and browse to the PPOP_Image folder. Select the 'image generated’. Click 'Save Reference’ and it will turn green. Close the window. Now, PPOPDemo program will refer to the 'image generated' as 'golden image'
Using teach pendant, in ‘Cartesian’ mode and speed ‘1%’, move the component slowly until it is plug in to the corresponding PCB holes
Teach this point as 1021, C1PluginDown (in 'World' mode). Then, change the mode to 'User' and select '1' under 'UF'. Select to highlight row 1022, C1PluginDownUF, click 'Teach' again

copy one row' 1022, and 'paste one row' to 1020, C1PluginUpUF.  Edit only the Z value of 1020 to be around 20mm more than that of 1022. For example, if the Z value of 1022 = -35(mm), edit the Z value of 1020 to be around -15(mm) with the remaining X, Y and RZ values unchanged. Remember to 'Save'

properties.UserOperation_Name: Start the conveyor belt and make sure it is moving
Go to Ebox under the robot arm to switch on the machine
Ensure that components are available on first row of tray. Ensure that no component is on gripper

Log in to PPOP computer.
Username : SRV-SG.SMART
Password : (contact machine owner for log-in credentials)
Double click DRAstudio on desktop.  If by any instances error popped out, just click ok to ignore.
Login.(contact machine owner for log-in credentials)
Click Ethernet. Click Connect. Once connected, the Ethernet symbol will turn GREEN. Make sure the Teach Pendant symbol is in ORANGE. If not, go to the teach pendant and press the Teach Pendant symbol
Click Play to run the program
Open the PPOPDemo folder on desktop. Double click on P-PPOP_demo
Click Start. Wait till the 2 IDLE boxes turn GREEN. (means that line camera is linked)
